title: Automation.com - All Industrial Automation News and Products

items.title: Frog Force 503 Robotics Team Cuts and Forms Metal
items.summary:
- The *Frog Force 503* robotics team toured BLM GROUP USA to explore advanced metal fabrication technologies.
- The event included live demonstrations of state-of-the-art machinery, enhancing the team's engineering knowledge.
- This partnership aims to foster creative solutions and long-term collaboration between education and industry.

items.title: The Collaborative Revolution in Manufacturing
items.author: Dijam Panigrahi
items.summary:
- The integration of *AI*, *digital twins*, and **cobots** is transforming manufacturing and logistics, enhancing productivity and safety.
- AI optimizes operations while digital twins allow for virtual testing, reducing risks in deployments.
- Collaborative robots free human workers from repetitive tasks, enabling them to focus on higher-value activities, supported by *upskilling* technologies like AR/VR.

items.title: Comau Has Built an In-House Dry Room to Develop Cell Manufacturing Solutions at an International Level
Binks Celebrates New Global Headquarters
items.summary:
- *Binks* unveiled its new **120,000-square-foot** global headquarters in Shoreview, Minnesota, on July 15, 2025.
- The facility centralizes multiple legacy sub-brands and enhances their commitment to **operational excellence** and **sustainability**.
- This strategic move is part of Binks' evolution under “*The Binks Way*,” aiming to lead in **fluid handling technology**.

items.title: Binks Celebrates New Global Headquarters in Shoreview, Minnesota, Marking Bold Transformation in Fluid Technology
ISA Recognizes 2025 Celebrating Excellence Awardees
items.summary:
- The *International Society of Automation (ISA)* has announced its 2025 award recipients.  
- The *Celebrating Excellence awards* aim to recognize outstanding contributions in automation.  
- This year's awardees will be honored during the *Automation Summit and Expo* in October 2025.

items.title: NORD Rises From Silver to Gold With EcoVadis for Sustainability Efforts
items.summary:
NORD DRIVESYSTEMS has achieved the **EcoVadis gold medal** for 2025, highlighting its commitment to sustainability by ranking in the top *4%* of globally rated companies.
- Scoring *85/100* in the Environment category, NORD focuses on integrating sustainability in its products and enhancing energy efficiency.
- Initiatives span *five areas*: Products, Governance, Environment, People, and Supply Chain, aiming for comprehensive sustainable practices across operations.

items.title: Global Collaborative Robot Shipment Growth Drops
items.summary:
- Global collaborative robot shipment growth fell to *13.8%* in 2024 due to economic pressures.
- A significant recovery is expected, with shipments anticipated to grow by *23.9%* in 2026.
- Key drivers include labor shortages, rising costs, and *increased adoption* in both manufacturing and service sectors.

items.title: MAHLE Invests in Global Knowledge Transfer
items.summary:
- MAHLE is expanding its *training programs* to meet the needs of technicians and employees in the changing market.  
- A new *Global Training Center* in Stuttgart will serve as a model for similar setups in other countries.  
- The updated training portal offers *flexible learning options*, including online courses and access to over 120 technical documents, in multiple languages.

items.title: The Carbon ROI of AI: Scaling Sustainable Energy
items.author: Philippe Rambach
items.summary:
*AI can achieve up to a 1:500 carbon ROI, making it crucial for sustainability.*
*Key pillars include energy efficiency, electrification, and scalability.*
*Organizations should choose efficient AI models to maximize carbon savings during deployment.*

items.title: Enterprise Automation Index 2025: 73% of Companies Increased Automation Spend
Decarbonization in the Metals Industry: Buzzword or Business Imperative?
Applied Manufacturing Technologies Advances Ignition Capabilities with Gold Certification
ESD Alliance Reports Q1 2025 Revenue Growth
items.summary:
- The Electronic System Design (ESD) industry achieved *$5.1 billion* in revenue for Q1 2025, marking a *12.8% increase* from the previous year.
- Revenue across all product categories grew, with **Semiconductor IP** and **Services** showing significant double-digit increases.
- All regions reported growth, with the *Americas* leading at *14%*, followed by *EMEA* and *Japan* with strong gains as well.

items.title: o9 Appoints Brett Theisen as CRO
items.summary:
- *Brett Theisen* has been appointed as the Chief Revenue Officer at *o9 Solutions*. 
- His experience includes leadership roles at QAD and NiCE, focusing on accelerating *revenue growth* and market expansion. 
- The appointment aligns with o9's goal to enhance enterprise planning and execution capabilities through *AI innovation*.

items.title: Rethinking Requirements in AI-Driven Product Development
items.author: Rob McAveney
items.summary:
- Modern requirements management is evolving from being a mere checklist to a strategic asset crucial for *successful product development*.
- Emphasizing a *data-centric approach*, organizations are encouraged to utilize AI for enhanced traceability and risk management.
- Adopting industry standards and semantic alignment is vital for breaking down *silos* and enhancing collaboration in complex projects.

items.title: KUKA Robotics at PACK EXPO 2025
items.summary:
- KUKA Robotics will showcase innovative robotics solutions emphasizing *ease of operation* and *flexibility* at PACK EXPO 2025.
- Key exhibits include the **KR C5 industrial robot controller** and various advanced systems for *palletizing, case packing*, and *intralogistics*.
- The event includes an educational session by KUKA’s Rich Parkhurst on *simplifying robotics* for smarter engineering.

items.title: Ethical AI: Why Humans Matter More Than Ever in AI-driven Manufacturing
items.author: Debasis Bisoi
items.summary:
- *AI's integration in manufacturing* has evolved from mere automation to complex decision-making that boosts productivity and efficiency.
- The ethical use of AI necessitates a framework ensuring *transparency*, *human oversight*, and adherence to legal principles.
- Engaging employees in the AI process is crucial; businesses should focus on *reskilling* and fostering trust to enhance AI's role in augmenting rather than replacing human efforts.

items.title: 'AI Needs a Body, and Robotics Needs AI'
items.summary:
- The Hexagon report highlights the *fusion of AI and robotics*, indicating a pivotal moment for industries and workforces.
- Concerns include *integration challenges* and the need for *upskilling*, as 41% of organizations struggle with embedding robotics into existing systems.
- A vision for 2035 suggests a likely *managed mesh economy*, where interoperable robots perform routine tasks, allowing for smoother transitions in the workforce.

items.title: Japan’s Car Industry Has Highest Robot Installations in Five Years
items.summary:
- In 2024, Japan’s automotive industry installed about *13,000 industrial robots*, an 11% increase from the previous year.
- Japan currently holds *38% of global robot production* and ranks 4th in robot density worldwide.
- The industry is undergoing a transformation to accommodate *alternative powertrains*, including battery and hydrogen-fueled vehicles.

items.title: BRESSNER Technology Relocates Headquarters to Puchheim
items.summary:
* BRESSNER Technology is moving its headquarters to Puchheim on August 1, 2025, to accommodate *growth* and improve *customer service*.
* The new address for the company will be Boschstraße 2A, 82178 Puchheim, Germany, but all other company information will remain unchanged.
* CEO Martin Stiborski emphasizes that this relocation marks a *strategic milestone* for future growth and better collaboration with partners and customers.

items.title: BitFlow and Advantech Facilitate Next Generation of Autonomous Mobile Robots
The Festo North American Regional Service Center Embraces Clean Energy
How to Reduce False Positives in AI-Powered Quality Control
items.author: Zac Amos
items.summary:
- **AI enhances quality control** but can lead to excessive *false positives* that waste resources.
- Addressing **root causes** like model overfitting and poor data integrity is crucial for improvement.
- Implementing *seven proven strategies* such as enhancing data quality and using human-in-the-loop systems can mitigate false positives effectively.

items.title: ISA Awards Scholarships to 33 Students from 7 Countries
Machinery Orders Slow in May While Preserving Year-Over-Year Gains
items.summary:
- In May 2025, new metalworking machinery orders totaled *$392.7 million*, an 11.8% drop from April but up 2.7% from last year.
- The aerospace sector exhibited significant order activity, with *nondefense aircraft orders up 164%* compared to 2024.
- Economic uncertainty remains, but new tax incentives could encourage further *machinery investments* by manufacturers in the latter half of 2025.

items.title: Global Industrial Robots Market Contracts 5.8% in 2024
items.author: Interact Analysis
items.summary: The global industrial robots market experienced a *5.8% decline* in 2024, driven by reduced demand and lower prices. *APAC remains the dominant region*, while Europe struggles with a projected contraction of *8.1%*. Recovery is anticipated in *2025*, especially in the Americas and Asia, although Europe may lag behind.

items.title: Leading Single Pair Ethernet Networks Unite
items.summary:
- Two major networks, SPE Industrial Partner Network and Single Pair Ethernet System Alliance, are collaborating to enhance *Single Pair Ethernet* technology.
- Their first joint activities include participation in key events like SPS Atlanta and the SPE Forum in Germany.
- The collaboration aims to *internationalize* SPE, making its advantages visible and accessible globally, thereby driving digitalization in industrial settings.

items.title: Comau Honored With 2025 Panda D’Oro Sustainability Award
items.summary:
- Comau received the 2025 *Panda D’Oro Sustainability Award* for its dedication to sustainable development in China. 
- The award highlights Comau's comprehensive sustainability strategy and commitment to *green manufacturing*. 
- With innovations in electrification and digitalization, Comau aims to drive a *low-carbon industrial future* across its operations and partnerships.

items.title: Infor and AWS Collaborate for Generative AI
items.summary:
- Infor expands its collaboration with **Amazon Web Services** to enhance *generative AI* adoption among customers.  
 - The partnership combines Infor's expertise across various industries with AWS's cloud technologies for *co-innovation and co-selling*.  
 - Significant growth in AWS Marketplace revenue and collaboration showcases the success and impact of this strategic alliance.

items.title: Mobile Robot Market Forecast Slashed: Tariffs and Uncertainty Take Their Toll
items.author: Ash Sharma
items.summary:
- The *mobile robot market* forecast for 2025 has been reduced by **$800 million**, reflecting *geopolitical and economic challenges*. 
- Major factors include *global tariffs* affecting supply chains and shifts in investment strategies amid high uncertainty. 
- The mobile robot industry is predicted to grow more slowly, now forecasting a **CAGR of 21%** instead of 26% over the next five years.

items.title: MaintainX Raises $150M to Transform Asset Management
items.summary:
- MaintainX has raised *$150M* in Series D funding to boost its AI capabilities for asset management.
- The platform aims to transform maintenance processes from reactive to proactive using *AI-driven insights*.
- With this investment, MaintainX intends to expand its market reach and enhance operational efficiency amid *economic challenges*.

items.title: Siemens Completes Acquisition of ebm-papst’s Industrial Drive Technology Business
items.summary:
The acquisition enhances Siemens' capabilities in *automation solutions*.
- Siemens now markets ebm-papst’s technology as *Mechatronic Systems*, focusing on innovative drive systems. 
- This adds *650 employees* and integrates into their *Xcelerator portfolio*, boosting the company's market position.
- The initiative aligns with Siemens' goal for *sustainable solutions* and the expansion of *intelligent transport systems*.

items.title: Penguin Solutions Completes Redomiciliation to the United States
items.summary:
- Penguin Solutions has successfully transitioned its parent company from the *Cayman Islands* to **Delaware**. 
- The change was approved by shareholders and sanctioned by the *Grand Court of the Cayman Islands*. 
- Trading of the newly formed company on *Nasdaq* begins on **July 1, 2025** without impacts to employees or operations.

items.title: Emerson Foundry Wins 2025 Better Project Award
items.summary:
- Emerson received the *2025 Better Project Award* for energy efficiency improvements at its South Milwaukee foundry.  
- A new building management system reduced *natural gas consumption by 20%* and mitigated *9% of the emissions footprint*.  
- The project led to *$127,000 in annual savings* with a payback period of under a year, enhancing competitiveness in sustainable manufacturing.

items.title: IFS Appoints Kriti Sharma as CEO of Nexus Black
items.summary:
- *Kriti Sharma* has been appointed CEO of **Nexus Black**, enhancing IFS’s focus on Industrial AI. 
- Sharma comes from **Thomson Reuters** and is recognized for her contributions to ethical AI, including awards from *Forbes* and the *United Nations*. 
- The aim of the Nexus Black initiative is to create industry-specific AI solutions for sectors like manufacturing and energy, improving operational efficiency.

items.title: Enhanced NEMA Standards for Motor Performance
items.summary:
- The *NEMA Premium program* enhances energy efficiency standards for electric motors, benefiting municipal, industrial, and commercial sectors.
- This initiative could save *5,800 gigawatts* of electricity over the next decade, equating to a significant reduction in carbon emissions.
- The upgraded standards are crucial for meeting increasing power demands amid evolving energy landscapes, ensuring reliable performance and sustainability.

items.title: Festo Products Considered Critical Infrastructure
items.summary:
- The **Cybersecurity & Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA)** recognizes Festo products as critical infrastructure in the U.S. 
- Festo developed a **Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT)** to address vulnerabilities and enhance product security. 
- The company aims for compliance with the **EU Cyber Resilience Act** by 2027, ensuring secure development and incident reporting practices.

items.title: Schneider Electric Announces U.S. Winners of Sustainability Awards
items.summary:
- Schneider Electric announced the U.S. winners of its *third annual* **Sustainability Impact Awards** recognizing achievements in efficiency and innovation.
- The awards honored organizations like **Compass Data Centers**, **Equinix**, **Lenovo**, and **The New Terminal One at JFK** for their sustainable initiatives and technological advancements.
- Winning organizations will receive support for their sustainability goals and co-marketing materials as recognition of their contributions.

items.title: AI Adoption Surges in Life Sciences Manufacturing
items.author: Rockwell Automation
items.summary:
- *95% of life sciences manufacturers* are using or evaluating smart technology, driven by pressures to improve efficiency and quality.
- **AI's primary applications** include enhancing product quality (53%), streamlining operations (50%), and strengthening cybersecurity (48%).
- The sector is grappling with a *skilled labor shortage*, with 26% citing it as the top growth barrier, leading many to leverage AI and automation for workforce support.

items.title: Registration Opens for ISA's Automation Summit and Expo
items.summary:
- *Registration is now open* for the Automation Summit and Expo, scheduled for 5 to 9 October 2025.
- The event will include *workshops*, *technical sessions*, and an *expo*, featuring exclusive training opportunities.
- Attendees can also look forward to the *ISA awards gala*, honoring outstanding automation professionals.

items.title: Motion Industries Opens New Branch in Quebec
items.summary:
- Motion Industries, Inc. has opened a new sales branch in *Val-d'Or, Quebec*, enhancing its service capabilities in Northern Quebec.
- The branch, which officially opened on June 2, 2025, is part of a network of approximately 70 locations across Canada, offering extensive *product and engineering services*.
- This initiative aims to create *local job opportunities* and drive economic growth in the region by providing faster service and fostering community relationships.

items.title: FLIR Thermal Vision Protects Ireland’s Electricity Grid
items.summary:
- FLIR's thermal monitoring system enhances *early fire detection* for Ireland's power grid, protecting 25% of its electricity supply.
- By providing immediate alerts, the system prevents cascade failures that could disrupt the grid during peak demands.
- This innovative solution paves the way for safer, more reliable energy infrastructure amid the transition to *renewable energy*.

items.title: Why Your Company Should Shift to Digital Logging
items.author: Asmar Atif
items.summary:
- *Digital logging* enhances operational efficiency by reducing errors and improving data accessibility.
- Transitioning from paper logs improves compliance and audit processes while ensuring accurate record-keeping.
- Overall, digital solutions foster better communication across shifts and turn data into valuable insights for long-term planning.

items.title: SJE Celebrates 50 Years of Innovation and Impact
items.summary:
- **SJE** celebrates 50 years of *innovation*, showcasing its legacy in control solutions.
- Founded in 1975, SJE has become a global leader with over *800 employees*, numerous patents, and multiple brands.
- Looking forward, SJE aims to expand its global impact while continuing to focus on *sustainable water solutions*.

items.title: Dacke Industri Expands in Europe Through Strategic UK Acquisition
items.summary:
- Dacke Industri has acquired an *80% share* in BTL-UK Ltd, strengthening its presence in Europe. 
- The acquisition enhances collaboration within their *Fluid Power Technology Division*, focusing on customer needs. 
- BTL-UK Ltd is a leading manufacturer of *bearings* and *mechanical components*, serving diverse industries globally.

items.title: Siemens and Microsoft Collaborate on IoT for Buildings
items.summary:
- Siemens announces a partnership with Microsoft to enhance **IoT interoperability** for buildings using **Azure IoT Operations**.
- The integration aims to reduce efforts by up to **80%**, enabling better data accessibility and sustainability for large enterprise customers.
- This collaboration emphasizes **open standards** for IoT, paving the way for improved **data-driven insights** in building management.

items.title: Mouser Electronics New Product Insider: Q2 2025 Highlights
items.summary:
- Mouser Electronics has launched over **15,000 new parts** in Q2 2025, including significant **semiconductor** and **AI** components.
- Notable new products include **ROHM microcontrollers**, **AI cameras** from **Seeed Studio**, and **STMicroelectronics' IMU** for advanced sensing applications.
- Mouser emphasizes its commitment to offering *100% certified, genuine products* and extensive technical resources for customers.

items.title: Remote Operations Need Peak-Performance Batteries
items.author: Sol Jacobs
items.summary:
- Industrial applications require specialized *batteries* for extreme environments and remote locations.
- Selecting the right battery involves detailed understanding of *power requirements* and environmental challenges.
- Expertise from a qualified applications engineer can enhance battery longevity and reliability, maximizing *return on investment*.

items.title: Topical Roundup: June 2025
items.author: Melissa Landon
items.summary:
- The article outlines major advancements in *automation* and the relevance of technologies like *IIoT* and *digital twins* in modern industries.
- Highlights include the importance of *Automated Test Equipment* in electronics and the future of *software-defined automation*.
- Additionally, it discusses strategies for *skills development* and *equipment management* in an evolving workforce landscape.
